newsitem.title: FRANCE: France's CSG tax to apply to dividends - Arthuis.
newsitem.headline: France's CSG tax to apply to dividends - Arthuis.

text.p: French Finance Minister Jean Arthuis said on Friday that the CSG, a flat tax on most income, would apply to dividends.

Asked on radio about the extension of the CSG (Generalised Social Contribution), announced on Thursday as part of Prime Minister Alain Juppe's tax overhaul, Arthuis said this would apply "to certain incomes which at the moment do not fall within the CSG," such as income from investment and capital.
"There are...some revenues subject to the flat tax on investment income and others on dividends which are not covered by this tax. There will be an extension this time," he said.
The government announced on Thursday it was raising the CSG tax to 3.4 percent from 2.4 percent, as part of fiscal reforms.
It said it is cutting 1.3 percentage points off payroll charges to fund healthcare.
Altogether, it will raise seven billion francs in extra taxes to fund the welfare system.
